introduction: Get 50% off your first crate of a monthly subscription with KiwiCo at https://www.kiwico.com/kurzges

vocabulary.definition: to destroy or ruin something completely
vocabulary.example: The earthquake devastated the small town, leaving many homeless.

vocabulary.definition: to give new energy or strength to something
vocabulary.example: The new manager reinvigorated the team with fresh ideas and motivation.
Despite facing many challenges, the company's robust financial strategy kept it afloat.

vocabulary.definition: a great disaster resulting in widespread destruction and loss of life
vocabulary.example: In the movie, the hero fights to prevent an apocalypse caused by a deadly virus outbreak.

vocabulary.definition: fast and energetic in a rather wild and uncontrolled way
vocabulary.example: During the holiday season, the shopping malls are filled with frenetic activity as people rush to buy gifts.

vocabulary.definition: the brutal and indiscriminate killing of many people
vocabulary.example: The village was in shock after the massacre of innocent civilians by the invading army.
